job_description: Company Description: McDonald‚Äôs growth strategy, Accelerating the Arches, encompasses all aspects of our business as the leading global omni-channel restaurant brand. As the consumer landscape shifts we are using our competitive advantages to further strengthen our brand. One of our core growth strategies is to Double Down on the 3Ds (Delivery, Digital and Drive Thru). McDonald‚Äôs will accelerate technology innovation so 65M+ customers a day will experience a fast, easy experience, whether at one of our 25,000 and growing Drive thrus, through McDelivery, dine-in or takeaway. McDonald‚Äôs Global Technology is here to power tomorrow‚Äôs feel-good moments. That‚Äôs why you‚Äôll find us at the forefront of transformative technology, exploring new and innovative ways to serve our millions of customers and spread happiness one delicious Hot Fudge Sundae-dipped fry at a time. Using AI, robotics and emerging tech, we‚Äôre digitizing the Golden Arches. Combine that with our unparalleled global scale, and we‚Äôre reshaping all areas of the business, industry and every community that is home to a McDonald‚Äôs restaurant. We face complex tech challenges every day. But that‚Äôs where our diverse and talented teams come in. They‚Äôre made up of the best and brightest from all over the globe, and they thrive in the space where feel-good meets fast-paced. Check out the McDonald‚Äôs Global Technology Technical Blog to learn how technology and our global team are directly enabling the Accelerating the Arches strategy. Department Overview McDonald‚Äôs, one of the most recognized brands in the world, is seeking a skilled Software Development Engineer to lead the development of our in-store technology as part of Commercial Product & Platform organization. The Commercial Product & Platform vision develops global technology products and platforms that delight our customers and enable our crews to operate our restaurants reliably and effectively. The Software Engineer I role works with the Sr Engineering Manager, Chapter Lead. In this role, you will be responsible for the design, development, testing and maintenance of the McDonald‚Äôs restaurant software. Restaurant Technology software includes application user interface, API layer software, data management, and data communication with external systems. The software needs to meet stringent reliability and performance requirements as well as the needs of our customers. The biggest area of increase in our spending has been in technology, which is helping to drive our growth. We‚Äôre looking at how to use technology to improve the customer experience and build new customer experiences. We‚Äôre also exploring technologies that can help us reduce or eliminate repetitive tasks and make employees‚Äô jobs more exciting and rewarding. With all the new projects and initiatives, it is an exciting time to be on the team that is helping to make a Better McDonald's!Accountabilities & Responsibilities Develop marketing automation workflows focused on marketing communications & experience personalization such as push notifications, emails, and mobile app personalized experiences Conceptualize customer segmentation to support Marketing Automation based on knowledge of pre-existing data structures Translate business requests for marketing capabilities, into clear technical requirements that include data properties needed for implementing marketing automations Technical requirement solicitation and documentation skills to effectively capture and communicate marketing automation solutions/initiatives to key collaborators Ensure that all technical work aligns with the business objectives and marketing strategies Triage issues and defects - capturing, prioritizing and remediating for marketing automations Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or similar engineering field or equivalent years of experience. Minimum 1+ years of non-internship professional marketing automation experience with a marketing or advertising automation technology system Experience in implementing marketing automation elements such as segments, audiences, and decision-splits Basic understanding of marketing automation concepts and design principles ‚Äì proven track record to understand how structured data can be translated into marketing segments and other automations that provide personalized experiences/communications to customers Understanding of core technologies for web content development- HTML, CSS, and JavaScript Extensive experience in working with key data interchange formats including JSON and XML, demonstrating a strong ability to integrate, manipulate, and manage complex data structures across diverse systems and applications Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams in sophisticated environments Excellent documentation and communication skills to bridge the gap between business strategy and technical teams. Hands on experience with JIRA/Confluence expected Preferred Skills: Front-end development skills specific to marketing automation. Proficiency in templating languages such as Liquid, Jinja, Handlebars or similar language Knowledge of working with key data interchange formats including JSON and XML, demonstrating a strong ability to integrate, manipulate, and manage complex data structures across diverse systems and applications Compensation Bonus Eligible: Yes Benefits Eligible: YesSalary Range The expected salary range for this role is $84,051.00 - $105,064.00 per year The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we may also consider your experience, and other job-related factors. Additional Information: Benefits eligible: This position offers health and welfare benefits, a 401(k) plan, adoption assistance program, educational assistance program, flexible ways of working, and time off policies (including sick leave, parental leave, and vacation/PTO). Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on job classification and length of employment. Bonus eligible: This position is eligible for a bonus, calculated based on individual and company performance. McDonald‚Äôs is an equal opportunity employer committed to the diversity of our workforce. We promote an inclusive work environment that creates feel-good moments for everyone. McDonald‚Äôs provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities as part of the application or hiring process or to perform the essential functions of their job. If you need assistance accessing or reading this job posting or otherwise feel you need an accommodation during the application or hiring process, please contact mcdhrbenefits@us.mcd.com. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis. McDonald‚Äôs provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to sex, sex stereotyping, pregnancy (including pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), race, color, religion, ancestry or national origin, age, disability status, medical condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, protected military or veteran status, citizenship status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Nothing in this job posting or description should be construed as an offer or guarantee of employment.

Who We Are Citizen Health was founded on the belief ‚Äî shaped by firsthand lived experiences navigating healthcare ‚Äî that having the right advocate is the single most important factor in achieving better care and outcomes. By uniquely combining data, AI, and community, Citizen is building a personalized AI advocate powered by patients' complete medical histories and data from thousands of other patients to generate personalized insights for clinical decisions and day-to-day challenges. Starting in rare and complex conditions, patients share their data in exchange for value, enabling biopharma and researchers with seamless access to patients and regulatory-grade data, shaving years off drug development for much-needed treatments. Citizen is founded by experienced entrepreneurs with multiple successes under their belts and is funded by top-tier investors including 8VC, Transformation Capital, and Headline Ventures, among others. We are a mission-driven team excited to be building the future of consumer healthcare. The Role We're seeking a full-stack Software Engineer to work on the development of our patient, partner, and company web applications. This role is crucial in creating intuitive, efficient, and responsive user interfaces that will directly impact our users' experience and our platform's success. As a key part of our engineering team, you will build high-performance, scalable, and accessible user interfaces that use AI to serve diverse user groups including rare disease patients, healthcare providers, researchers, and our internal teams. You will join a team that highly leverages the latest AI coding assistants (e.g. Cursor, Claude Code, Codex, etc.) to implement features at very high velocity. Your work will be at the heart of our mission, translating complex health data and research findings into user-friendly interfaces that empower patients, facilitate groundbreaking research, and streamline our internal operations. Who you are You‚Äôre a builder and problem-solver who thrives in fast-paced, innovative environments. You‚Äôve worked on consumer or data-rich products, enjoy end-to-end ownership, and collaborate closely with teammates to ship real value. You‚Äôre comfortable diving into your strengths (frontend, backend, or full-stack) and curious about how AI can improve the experiences we deliver for patients, providers, researchers, and internal teams. You will likely be a fit if you have 0-3 years of professional software engineering experience with a track record of launching user-facing features or services. Strength in one or more of the following: Frontend: JavaScript/TypeScript with a modern framework (e.g., React/Vue), semantic HTML/CSS, accessibility, and performance for data-heavy UIs. Product Engineering: Strong product sense and UX instincts; you use user needs, data, and experiments to guide decisions and iterate quickly. Working knowledge of performance, scalability, and security fundamentals appropriate to your layer (e.g., web perf, API efficiency, data modeling, auth). Experience with testing (e.g., Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress, PyTest) and comfort with code reviews and iterative development. You will receive bonus points if you have Experience with frontend state management (e.g., Redux, MobX, Recoil) or a backend framework (e.g., Express, FastAPI, Spring, Fiber). Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and modern build tooling. Proficiency with databases (SQL or NoSQL) and writing simple queries to inform product decisions. Experience with analytics/experimentation and/or accessibility best practices. Exposure to cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP/Azure), containers, and observability is a plus. Why Join Us? At Citizen Health, you will be part of an ambitious mission to build innovative AI-driven solutions that redefine the consumer healthcare experience and improve outcomes for millions. We value curiosity, creativity, and collaboration, and we believe in empowering every team member to have an impact. Here, you‚Äôll find: The chance to work on pioneering AI technologies and solve complex problems that push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in healthcare The freedom to lead your projects and shape the company‚Äôs direction in a mission-driven environment where your work makes a real impact A fast-paced, high-growth setting that brings expanding opportunities and clear paths for career progression A supportive culture of learning, experimentation, and innovation, where new ideas are encouraged and explored A commitment to empathy and diversity, recognizing that our greatest strengths come from our varied perspectives and experiences Regular team activities and knowledge sharing, all within a culture that prioritizes well-being and connection Additional Perks Competitive salary + equity package Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance Unlimited paid time off, including a generous parental leave Flexible hybrid work environment Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion: Citizen Health is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Everyone deserves an equal chance to contribute and grow here ‚Äî regardless of race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. Don't meet every qualification? No worries! We believe that passion, curiosity, and the right mindset are just as important as a checklist of skills. If you‚Äôre excited about what we‚Äôre building, we encourage you to apply.

The simple task of buying software, services, or tools at work has become hopelessly complicated at even the most innovative companies in the world. Today, enterprises spend $120T+ per year globally (>30 times larger than annual consumer e-commerce spend) and rely on vendors more than ever before to run their businesses. Our cofounders started Zip in 2020 to address this seemingly intractable problem with a purpose-built procurement platform that provides a simple, consumer-grade user experience. Within the last 4 years, Zip has created a new category and developed the leading solution in this $50B+ TAM space. Today, the world‚Äôs leading companies like OpenAI, Snowflake, Anthropic, Coinbase, and Prudential rely on Zip to manage billions of dollars in spend. We have a world-class team coming from category-defining companies like Airbnb, Meta, Stripe, Salesforce, Apple, and Google. With a $2.2 billion valuation and $370 million in funding from Y Combinator, Tiger Global, BOND, DST Global, and CRV, we‚Äôre focused on developing cutting-edge technology, expanding into new global markets, and‚Äîabove all‚Äìdriving incredible value for our customers. Join us! Your Role As a Software Engineer you will be responsible for building Zip‚Äôs core products and architecture. You will ship features that will be immediately used by our customers, and will work with a tight-knit team that values open communication and cross-functional collaboration. We move quickly to solve a wide range of complex technical and product challenges. While we are an experienced team that can provide constant guidance and mentorship, we value engineers who can scope and solve difficult technical challenges. You Will Design and build highly reliable and resilient products and features Work closely with cross functional product and customer-facing teams to understand requirements and ship thoughtful solutions Write high-quality, extensible, and maintainable code Design and build scalable frontend applications and components Design and build APIs to drive existing and new features for a web-based application Qualifications Pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science or related technical field involving coding (e.g. physics or math), with a graduation date between December 2025 - June 2026 Experience with web applications and API development. At Zip, our stack includes Python, Javascript/TypeScript, React, and GraphQL Ability and interest to quickly learn new frameworks, architecture patterns, and programming languages as needed Fantastic written and verbal communication skills Prior internships in high-growth startup environment The salary range for this role is $140,000 - $145,000. The salary for this position is determined based on a variety of job-related factors that may include location, relevant experience, education, or particular skills and expertise. Perks & Benefits At Zip, we‚Äôre committed to providing our employees with everything they need to do their best work. üìà Start-up equity ü¶∑ Full health, vision & dental coverage üçΩÔ∏è Catered breakfasts, lunches & dinners for SF employees üöç Commuter benefit üö† Team building events & happy hours üå¥ Flexible PTO üíª Apple equipment plus home office budget üí∏ 401k plan We're looking to hire Zipsters and that means hiring people who take ownership, communicate openly, have an underdog mindset, and are excited to increase the pace of innovation for every business in the world. We encourage all candidates to apply even if your experience doesn't exactly match up to our job description. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workspace where everyone (regardless of age, religion, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, and more) feels like they belong. We look forward to hearing from you!

Full-Stack Developer, JuniorThe Opportunity:As a full-stack developer, you can resolve a problem with a complete end-to-end solution in a fast, agile environment. If you‚Äôre looking for the chance to not just develop software, but to help create a system that will make a difference, we need you on our team. We‚Äôre looking for a developer like you with an appetite to learn and the skills needed to develop software and systems from vision to production ready. This role is more than just coding. As a Full-Stack Developer at Booz Allen, you‚Äôll use your passion to learn new tools and techniques and identify needed system improvements. You‚Äôll help clients overcome their most difficult challenges using the latest architectural approaches, tools, and technologies. You‚Äôll help make sure the solution developed by the team considers the current architecture and operating environment, as well as future functionality and enhancements. Work with us as we shape systems for the better. Join us. The world can‚Äôt wait. You Have:Experience designing, modifying, developing, writing, and implementing software programming applications Experience with full-stack software developmentExperience with Java, C#, or PythonExperience with AWS, Azure, or Google CloudKnowledge of AWS cloud servicesAbility to obtain a Top Secret clearanceScheduled to obtain a Bachelor's degree by Summer 2026 or Winter 2026Nice If You Have:Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph examAWS Cloud CertificationsClearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.CompensationAt Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen‚Äôs benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual‚Äôs particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $52,900.00 to $108,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen‚Äôs total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.Identity StatementAs part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. We reserve the right to take your picture to verify your identity and prevent fraud.Work ModelOur people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you‚Äôll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.If this position is listed as onsite, you‚Äôll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.Commitment to Non-DiscriminationAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.DRE1

Who We Are Citizen Health was founded on the belief ‚Äî shaped by firsthand lived experiences navigating healthcare ‚Äî that having the right advocate is the single most important factor in achieving better care and outcomes. By uniquely combining data, AI, and community, Citizen is building a personalized AI advocate powered by patients' complete medical histories and data from thousands of other patients to generate personalized insights for clinical decisions and day-to-day challenges. Starting in rare and complex conditions, patients share their data in exchange for value, enabling biopharma and researchers with seamless access to patients and regulatory-grade data, shaving years off drug development for much-needed treatments. Citizen is founded by experienced entrepreneurs with multiple successes under their belts and is funded by top-tier investors including 8VC, Transformation Capital, and Headline Ventures, among others. We are a mission-driven team excited to be building the future of consumer healthcare. The Role We're seeking a full-stack Software Engineer to work on the development of our patient, partner, and company web applications. This role is crucial in creating intuitive, efficient, and responsive user interfaces that will directly impact our users' experience and our platform's success. As a key part of our engineering team, you will build high-performance, scalable, and accessible user interfaces that use AI to serve diverse user groups including rare disease patients, healthcare providers, researchers, and our internal teams. You will join a team that highly leverages the latest AI coding assistants (e.g. Cursor, Claude Code, Codex, etc.) to implement features at very high velocity. Your work will be at the heart of our mission, translating complex health data and research findings into user-friendly interfaces that empower patients, facilitate groundbreaking research, and streamline our internal operations. Who you are You‚Äôre a builder and problem-solver who thrives in fast-paced, innovative environments. You‚Äôve worked on consumer or data-rich products, enjoy end-to-end ownership, and collaborate closely with teammates to ship real value. You‚Äôre comfortable diving into your strengths (frontend, backend, or full-stack) and curious about how AI can improve the experiences we deliver for patients, providers, researchers, and internal teams. You will likely be a fit if you have 0-3 years of professional software engineering experience with a track record of launching user-facing features or services. Strength in one or more of the following: Frontend: JavaScript/TypeScript with a modern framework (e.g., React/Vue), semantic HTML/CSS, accessibility, and performance for data-heavy UIs. Product Engineering: Strong product sense and UX instincts; you use user needs, data, and experiments to guide decisions and iterate quickly. Working knowledge of performance, scalability, and security fundamentals appropriate to your layer (e.g., web perf, API efficiency, data modeling, auth). Experience with testing (e.g., Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress, PyTest) and comfort with code reviews and iterative development. You will receive bonus points if you have Experience with frontend state management (e.g., Redux, MobX, Recoil) or a backend framework (e.g., Express, FastAPI, Spring, Fiber). Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and modern build tooling. Proficiency with databases (SQL or NoSQL) and writing simple queries to inform product decisions. Experience with analytics/experimentation and/or accessibility best practices. Exposure to cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP/Azure), containers, and observability is a plus. Why Join Us? At Citizen Health, you will be part of an ambitious mission to build innovative AI-driven solutions that redefine the consumer healthcare experience and improve outcomes for millions. We value curiosity, creativity, and collaboration, and we believe in empowering every team member to have an impact. Here, you‚Äôll find: The chance to work on pioneering AI technologies and solve complex problems that push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in healthcare The freedom to lead your projects and shape the company‚Äôs direction in a mission-driven environment where your work makes a real impact A fast-paced, high-growth setting that brings expanding opportunities and clear paths for career progression A supportive culture of learning, experimentation, and innovation, where new ideas are encouraged and explored A commitment to empathy and diversity, recognizing that our greatest strengths come from our varied perspectives and experiences Regular team activities and knowledge sharing, all within a culture that prioritizes well-being and connection Additional Perks Competitive salary + equity package Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance Unlimited paid time off, including a generous parental leave Flexible hybrid work environment Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion: Citizen Health is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Everyone deserves an equal chance to contribute and grow here ‚Äî regardless of race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. Don't meet every qualification? No worries! We believe that passion, curiosity, and the right mindset are just as important as a checklist of skills. If you‚Äôre excited about what we‚Äôre building, we encourage you to apply.

Who We Are Citizen Health was founded on the belief ‚Äî shaped by firsthand lived experiences navigating healthcare ‚Äî that having the right advocate is the single most important factor in achieving better care and outcomes. By uniquely combining data, AI, and community, Citizen is building a personalized AI advocate powered by patients' complete medical histories and data from thousands of other patients to generate personalized insights for clinical decisions and day-to-day challenges. Starting in rare and complex conditions, patients share their data in exchange for value, enabling biopharma and researchers with seamless access to patients and regulatory-grade data, shaving years off drug development for much-needed treatments. Citizen is founded by experienced entrepreneurs with multiple successes under their belts and is funded by top-tier investors including 8VC, Transformation Capital, and Headline Ventures, among others. We are a mission-driven team excited to be building the future of consumer healthcare. The Role We're seeking a full-stack Software Engineer to work on the development of our patient, partner, and company web applications. This role is crucial in creating intuitive, efficient, and responsive user interfaces that will directly impact our users' experience and our platform's success. As a key part of our engineering team, you will build high-performance, scalable, and accessible user interfaces that use AI to serve diverse user groups including rare disease patients, healthcare providers, researchers, and our internal teams. You will join a team that highly leverages the latest AI coding assistants (e.g. Cursor, Claude Code, Codex, etc.) to implement features at very high velocity. Your work will be at the heart of our mission, translating complex health data and research findings into user-friendly interfaces that empower patients, facilitate groundbreaking research, and streamline our internal operations. Who you are You‚Äôre a builder and problem-solver who thrives in fast-paced, innovative environments. You‚Äôve worked on consumer or data-rich products, enjoy end-to-end ownership, and collaborate closely with teammates to ship real value. You‚Äôre comfortable diving into your strengths (frontend, backend, or full-stack) and curious about how AI can improve the experiences we deliver for patients, providers, researchers, and internal teams. You will likely be a fit if you have 0-3 years of professional software engineering experience with a track record of launching user-facing features or services. Strength in one or more of the following: Frontend: JavaScript/TypeScript with a modern framework (e.g., React/Vue), semantic HTML/CSS, accessibility, and performance for data-heavy UIs. Product Engineering: Strong product sense and UX instincts; you use user needs, data, and experiments to guide decisions and iterate quickly. Working knowledge of performance, scalability, and security fundamentals appropriate to your layer (e.g., web perf, API efficiency, data modeling, auth). Experience with testing (e.g., Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress, PyTest) and comfort with code reviews and iterative development. You will receive bonus points if you have Experience with frontend state management (e.g., Redux, MobX, Recoil) or a backend framework (e.g., Express, FastAPI, Spring, Fiber). Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and modern build tooling. Proficiency with databases (SQL or NoSQL) and writing simple queries to inform product decisions. Experience with analytics/experimentation and/or accessibility best practices. Exposure to cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP/Azure), containers, and observability is a plus. Why Join Us? At Citizen Health, you will be part of an ambitious mission to build innovative AI-driven solutions that redefine the consumer healthcare experience and improve outcomes for millions. We value curiosity, creativity, and collaboration, and we believe in empowering every team member to have an impact. Here, you‚Äôll find: The chance to work on pioneering AI technologies and solve complex problems that push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in healthcare The freedom to lead your projects and shape the company‚Äôs direction in a mission-driven environment where your work makes a real impact A fast-paced, high-growth setting that brings expanding opportunities and clear paths for career progression A supportive culture of learning, experimentation, and innovation, where new ideas are encouraged and explored A commitment to empathy and diversity, recognizing that our greatest strengths come from our varied perspectives and experiences Regular team activities and knowledge sharing, all within a culture that prioritizes well-being and connection Additional Perks Competitive salary + equity package Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance Unlimited paid time off, including a generous parental leave Flexible hybrid work environment Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion: Citizen Health is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome applicants of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Everyone deserves an equal chance to contribute and grow here ‚Äî regardless of race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. Don't meet every qualification? No worries! We believe that passion, curiosity, and the right mindset are just as important as a checklist of skills. If you‚Äôre excited about what we‚Äôre building, we encourage you to apply.

Company Description: McDonald‚Äôs growth strategy, Accelerating the Arches, encompasses all aspects of our business as the leading global omni-channel restaurant brand. Starting in rare and complex conditions, patients share their data in exchange for value, enabling biopharma and researchers with seamless access to patients and regulatory-grade data, shaving years off drug development for much-needed treatments. Citizen is founded by experienced entrepreneurs with multiple successes under their belts and is funded by top-tier investors including 8VC, Transformation Capital, and Headline Ventures, among others. You will likely be a fit if you have 0-3 years of professional software engineering experience with a track record of launching user-facing features or services. Strength in one or more of the following: Frontend: JavaScript/TypeScript with a modern framework (e.g., React/Vue), semantic HTML/CSS, accessibility, and performance for data-heavy UIs. Product Engineering: Strong product sense and UX instincts; you use user needs, data, and experiments to guide decisions and iterate quickly. Experience with testing (e.g., Jest, React Testing Library, Cypress, PyTest) and comfort with code reviews and iterative development. STARTING PAY: $20.28 TO $22 DOQ SUMMARY As a GIS Analyst I, you'll help maintain the City‚Äôs maps and spatial data, ensuring it's kept accurate, usable, and up to date. This position supports a wide range of City services by maintaining data for parks, planning, water, wastewater, stormwater, zoning, public safety, and more. The work you do will be used by planners, engineers, field personnel, public safety, and other departments across the organization. Day to day, this role focuses on editing and maintaining GIS datasets, creating maps, running spatial queries, and occasionally verifying information in the field. You‚Äôll also help keep web maps current, respond to mapping requests from City staff, and assist with planning and projects that depend on good location data. ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES Maintains various GIS data including but not limited to: parks, public works, water utilities, wastewater, storm water, parcel, easement, zoning, land use, and public safety. Updates recently approved items as well as making needed corrections. Performs work in accordance with established GIS standards, procedures, and templates, referring unusual or complex issues to senior GIS staff or the GIS Manager. Assists with development and maintenance of GIS data resources to be utilized for public access of geographic data. Performs varied data gathering and entry to create, maintain, display and update Geographic Information Systems databases. Produces accurate maps and other representations of data for public use and field work activity. Performs field work to visually locate items to resolve conflicting information and ensure the accuracy of data. Compiles and integrates cartographic data from a wide variety of sources for inclusion in map documents. Creates and edits geospatial data, using GPS and digitizing techniques. Creates and edits maps, integrating a range of data formats. Performs basic review and analysis of geospatial and tabular data and produces mapping products using established tools, templates, and procedures. Assists in meeting with users to document data needs, project requirements, and required output using standard forms and guidance. Implements and follows established procedures to incorporate geospatial and tabular data into GIS maps and reports. Prepares sketches and maps for various presentations in collaboration with other departments. Provides special request maps for internal department and external requests. Provides a variety of information from GIS to property owners, citizens, architects, engineers, developers and others. Assists departments on projects involving field surveys, compiling statistical data relating to land use, population, social and economic characteristics and other research for various planning related studies. Helps maintain City websites with GIS-related information by updating map content and data links under the direction of supervisory or senior staff. Assists in the organization and filing of drawings, plans and other documents related to the maintenance and upkeep of record drawing information, including scanning documents and linking them to GIS software. Occasionally works after hours to complete projects and meet deadlines. Maintains a positive, helpful, constructive attitude and working relationship with team members, City employees, Elected Officials and the public. Participates in training and professional development to stay current with GIS software, tools, City standards, and evolving requirements. Performs other job-related duties as assigned. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Requires practical CAD/GIS experience sufficient to perform the duties of the position, typically at least one year. Formal education or training in GIS, Geography, Earth Science, Computer Science, Construction Science, or a related field, may be considered in lieu of some experience if it provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities. GIS Certification preferred. A valid Texas Driver‚Äôs License is required. Due to the level of access to potentially sensitive information, successful completion of a criminal background check is required. Background check must confirm eligibility for Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS) system access and CJIS eligibility must be maintained for the duration of employment. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES Knowledge and understanding of integrated GIS principles, systems, and technologies. Strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of constituencies in a diverse community. Ability to understand and document end-user information requirements and communicate them to other staff as needed. Ability to maintain effective working relationships with co-workers and the public. Knowledgeable in the use of GIS software and familiar with engineering and architectural terminology. Ability to review and perform basic analysis of geospatial and tabular data and produce mapping products using standard GIS tools and techniques. Knowledge of and ability to use Word, Excel, Outlook, or similar programs. Knowledgeable in the use of engineering and architectural scales. WORK ENVIRONMENT The employee works in dynamic environment that requires the employee to be sensitive to change and responsive to changing goals, priorities, and needs. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is required to exert up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 10 pounds of force to move objects. The employee must also balance, crawl, crouch, walk, stand, sit, hear, feel, finger, grasp, handle, reach, pull, push, speak, see, and talk.
